title: 'Dancing dragon' feathered dinosaur fossil discovered
description: About 120 million years ago, a "dancing dragon" lived in China's Jehol Province. The discovery of a fossil belonging to the small feathered dinosaur is new to science and helps bridge the gap between dinosaurs and birds.

title: Trump's lawyers claim impeachment charge against him is dangerous
New feathered dinosaur species discovered
description: A new dinosaur species called Wulong bohaiensis is offering researchers clues into the relationship between bird species and dinosaurs.

title: The US President's legal team calls the articles of impeachment 'constitutionally invalid' in a preview of the case they will make on the Senate floor
description: President Donald Trump's legal team on Monday filed a lengthy response calling the charges he committed impeachable offenses a "charade" in a preview of the case they will make on the Senate floor when the impeachment trial commences.

title: Virginia gun-rights rally opens peacefully amid fears of extremist violence
description: A gun-rights rally in Virginia's state capital kicked off Monday morning amid heavy security as authorities look to prevent the kind of violence that took place in nearby Charlottesville three years ago.

title: You won't be flying on a 737 Max anytime soon
description: No one knows when the Boeing 737 Max will return to service. But it won't be any time soon.

title: The New York Times' utterly confusing 2020 endorsement
description: At its most basic level, the 2020 Democratic primary process is about which one candidate distinguishes herself (or himself) as the person voters most trust to take on and beat President Donald Trump in November.

title: Virus spreads to Beijing as China confirms 139 new cases
description:
• China's new SARS-like virus spreads
• This may explain origins of new virus

title: SAG Awards 2020: Fashion on the red carpet
description: It was only mid-afternoon in LA when stars arrived for Sunday's Screen Actors Guild Awards, but the glamorous evening wear was already out in force.

title: One of Queen Victoria's old outfits was found in a cabinet
description: Items from an outfit that once belonged to Britain's Queen Victoria were found in a cabinet more than 100 years after they were placed there.

title: Michael Bloomberg: I would vote to convict Trump
description: Former New York mayor Michael Bloomberg would vote to convict President Donald Trump if he were a senator in the impeachment trial, he said in an interview that aired Monday.

title: Norway's governing coalition collapses over ISIS repatriation
description: Norway's ruling coalition has disbanded after the populist Progress Party (FRP) left the government, partly due to the repatriation of a mother with suspected ISIS links from Syria.

title: Pompeo says US diplomatic staffer is missing and presumed dead
description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced Monday that an American staffer from the US Mission in Colombia is missing and presumed dead after a boating accident over the weekend.

title: Opinion: The stakes of the impeachment trial are stratospheric
description: As the impeachment trial of President Donald Trump begins on Tuesday, many questions remain about how the process will play out and how it will ultimately impact Trump. This much is for sure: the stakes are stratospheric — for Trump, for those who surround him and for the United States.

title: An abandoned husky with 'weird' eyes has been adopted after her photos went viral
description: A Siberian husky that was surrendered to a New Jersey shelter because of "weird" eyes has been adopted after photos posted on Facebook went viral.

title: Abandoned dog with 'weird' eyes adopted after Facebook post
description: Jubilee, a 4-year-old Siberian husky, was surrendered to a New Jersey shelter because she had "weird" eyes caused by an eyelid deformity that makes it appear as if she's always surprised. Her breeder said she couldn't be sold, but when the shelter shared her photo, the internet fell in love.

title: Spain's new laws to clamp down on 'booze tourism'
description: They've got a reputation for sun-soaking, all-night-partying and all-round-hedonism, but Spain's Balearic Islands are attempting a rebrand.

title: Climate refugees cannot be sent back home, United Nations rules in landmark decision
description: Refugees fleeing the effects of the climate crisis cannot be forced to return home by their adoptive countries, a United Nations panel has ruled, in a landmark decision that could open the door to a flood of legal claims by displaced people around the world.

title: Tennis umpire tells off player for asking ball girl to peel a banana for him
New York Times editorial board breaks with the norm and endorses two candidates
The American Dream is much easier to achieve in Canada
description: If you're born in the United States, having wealthy parents matters a great deal to your chances of success, according to a new report.

title: Malaysia tells rich countries it won't be their 'garbage dump' and sends back plastic waste
description: Malaysia has sent back 150 shipping containers of plastic waste to rich countries including the United States, United Kingdom, France and Canada, insisting it won't be the "garbage dump" of the world.

title: Best things to do in Uzbekistan, an unmissable gem of Central Asia
description: A long time ago, Uzbekistan was the beating heart of the world.

title: Manhunt underway for suspect who fatally shot 10-year-old boy, Memphis police say
description: Memphis authorities are searching for the person responsible for the fatal shooting of a 10-year-old boy, police said Monday.

title: Why three little words mean so much to Britain's royals
description:
• Harry breaks silence over royal exit
• What Serena said when quizzed on Meghan

title: First new 2020 Corvette auctioned for $3 million
description: The first 2020 model year Corvette available for sale to a customer was auctioned off Saturday night for $3 million. The redesigned model is the first Corvette with its engine mounted behind the seats, rather than in the front under the hood.

title: Analysis: Trump's defense says abuse of power isn't impeachable
Why three little words mean so much to Britain's royals
Dwayne Johnson opens up about his dad's 'quick' death and thanks supporters
description: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson says he is "full of gratitude" for the love and support he's received in the wake of his father's death.

title: Auschwitz survivors bear witness as anti-Semitic attacks rise in the US
description: CNN's Melissa Bell speaks with Holocaust survivors for the 75th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp.

title: Let's not project our feelings onto Jennifer Aniston and Brad Pitt
See birds and golf ball-sized hail fall out of the sky
description: Parts of southeastern Australia are being pelted by golf ball-sized hailstones -- less than 24 hours after the region was hit by massive dust storms.

title: 19 nurses in same hospital unit gave birth to 19 babies
description: Nineteen nurses from the same NICU unit at a Nebraska hospital all gave birth to babies of their own during 2019.

title: US travel ban could morph into immigration ban with latest expansion, sources say
description: The Trump administration drafted plans to renew and expand its travel ban list to include immigration restrictions on seven additional countries, according to sources familiar with the process.

title: Singer-songwriter dies on stage at age 71
description: Americana singer and songwriter David Olney, whose music was recorded by Linda Ronstadt, Steve Young, Emmylou Harris and others, died of an apparent heart attack while performing on stage in Florida Saturday, according to a statement on his website. He was 71.

title: World's richest 1% have more than twice as much wealth as 6.9 billion people, Oxfam says
Couple uses wedding day to help dogs in need
description: A couple in Pennsylvania shared their wedding day with shelter dogs looking for a loving home.

title: Dershowitz in 1998: Doesn't have to be crime to impeach
description: In an interview from 1998 about the Clinton impeachment, attorney Alan Dershowitz says it "certainly doesn't have to be a crime" to be impeachable. This is opposite of his defense of President Trump over the weekend.

title: Coco Gauff defeats Venus Williams at Australian Open as Federer, Osaka and Serena also win
description: New year, new grand slam, same result.

title: 'Blue Monday' depression peak isn't real
description: As if we needed any more reason to ruminate over life's daily plights, today (January 20) is Blue Monday -- the third Monday of January, which is rumored to be the most depressing day of the year.

title: The fraught business of removing and selling street art murals
description: Banksy is well known for creating murals in the dead of night, frequently addressing social ills like homelessness or poverty. Tourists and fans gather around each of his new creations, often spurred to the site by a post on the anonymous artist's Instagram account. So the idea of removing one of these works from public view and selling it is bound to stir up strong emotions.

title: Who's next for McGregor after 40-second 'Cowboy' demolition?
description: Who's next for Conor McGregor? That is the question for the Irishman following his 40-second demolition of Donald 'Cowboy' Cerrone.

title: Another Italian town sells dozens of $1 homes
Horror in Waikiki: 2 police officers killed, 7 houses burn
This company says it's making 'food from thin air'
description: In Finland, scientists are making an entirely new ingredient out of air, water and electricity -- and they hope it could revolutionize the way our food is produced.

title: This could be the cause of new virus
description: Scientists have identified a new coronavirus, which has infected more than two hundred people since the initial outbreak in Wuhan, China. CNN's Kristie Lu Stout reports on the origins of the mysterious SARS-like virus and the scientific race to control it.

title: World's richest 1% have more than twice as much wealth as 6.9 billion people, Oxfam says
Violent unrest grips Beirut as 'week of rage' escalates
description: Violent clashes between police and anti-government protesters gripped sections of Beirut Sunday night, as part of a "week of rage" declared by protesters that has paralyzed much of the Lebanese capital.

title: Racist or part of history? Controversial signs spark debate in small Colorado town
description: A Colorado antique store is under fire for selling racist signs. The store's owner defended her decision to sell the merchandise in an interview with CNN affiliate KDVR.
